oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Markov-modulated floating-strike Asian options
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ocejo, Adriana
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantitative Finance - Pricing of Securities
Mathematics - Probability
60J70, 47H10, 91G20
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study the price of Asian options with floating-strike when the underlying asset price follows a Markov-modulated (or regime-switching) geometric Brownian motion and both the interest rate and diffusion coefficient depend on an independent continuous-time finite-state Markov chain. We propose an iterative procedure that converges to the option prices without recourse to solving a coupled PDE system. The method can also be applied to fixed-strike Asian options. Our approach makes use of path properties of Brownian motion and the Fixed-Point Theorem.
